intro: Roureopsis rubricarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited roureopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its most distinctive feature is its vibrant red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
